definition: having ample food and clothing (idiom); well fed and clothed
luxuriant/buxom/variant of 豐|丰[feng1]/variant of 風|风[feng1]/appearance/charm

sentences.english: Is happy life not only have ample food and clothing, also lies in the clear water, blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 幸福生活不只在于丰衣足食，也在于碧水蓝天。

sentences.english: If the Chinese are content for being fed, why ask for a change, in whatever name?
sentences.chinese: 如果中国人丰衣足食，那需要以什么名义来变革？

sentences.english: Jiao Zi looks like gold coin, implying a wealthy year ahead.
sentences.chinese: 饺子看起来像金元宝，意味来年丰衣足食。

sentences.english: Massage whole or in part by the United Nations and clothing.
sentences.chinese: 按摩可全部或部分受联合国丰衣足食。

sentences.english: We will became self-sufficient in food and clothing by producing them ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我们用自己动手的方法，达到丰衣足食的目的。

sentences.english: Now people have enough to eat and wear.
Some people live in plenty , while others haven ' t enough to eat.
sentences.chinese: 一些人过着丰衣足食的生活，而另一些人却吃不饱。

definition: to live in peace and work happily (idiom)
to have enough food and warm clothes/adequately provided
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
lit. to eat off one's own strength (idiom)/fig. to stand on one's own feet/to earn one's own living
to become rich by one's own efforts/self-made
favorable weather (idiom); good weather for crops
abundant harvest of all food crops/bumper grain harvest
